attributes.action: change the criteria for disabled persons bus passes and include autism
attributes.background: I'm campaigning for a change in policy for disabled bus passes as I do strongly agree people with autism should be able to apply for one yet the department for transport classes autism as a learning disability which people with autism can some times have a learning disability but not all
attributes.additional_details: The Department for transport should change there criteria to include autism as not everyone with autism has a learning disability

attributes.action: Unemployment benefits to stop after 2 years of claiming
attributes.background: Unemployment benefits should stop after claims of 2 years or more. The goverment said it would make work pay and put an end to career claiments. We want the goverment to make long time unemployed get back to work and make Britain great again.

attributes.action: Expand the Syrian refugee resettlement programme and increase aid.
attributes.background: The government should increase its pledge to resettle 20 000 Syrian refugees by 2020 as well as increase aid to help millions affected by the crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
While several Middle-Eastern nations have taken in millions of Syrian refugees, as well European countries such as Germany taking in hundreds of thousands so far, the UK government has pledged to resettle only 20 000, by 2020.

The US president has signed an executive order to ban Syrian refugees indefinitely, which will likely result in civilian deaths that could be avoided. One of the best responses from the UK to show its opposition would be to increase its pledge and increase aid.

attributes.action: Revise/Abolish stamp duty rules for first-time property buyers.
attributes.background: First time buyers (FTBs) should not have to pay stamp duty, the legacy agreement whereby this tax was relieved for FTBs should be reinstated. This would alleviate the financial challenges that FTBs face when attempting to get on the housing ladder which is further exacerbated in the South East
attributes.additional_details: There have been Government schemes introduced that are supposed to offset/assist FTBs entering the market however these are grossly prejudice to the London area and elsewhere in the UK. Outer Fringe areas of London have inflated housing markets due to their attractive location for commuting but schemes like the Help-to-Buy & Save-to-Buy have limits of £250,000 which is significantly below the average house price in areas such as Essex.

attributes.action: Advise the Queen to make London Borough of Richmond a Royal Borough
attributes.background: Richmond has two existing Royal Palaces (Hampton Court & Kew Palace) and a rich history of Royal connections, patronage and places. No borough deserves Royal status more than Richmond.
attributes.additional_details: I wrote to the Secretary of State a few years ago asking for Royal Borough status for Richmond and it was politely declined in favour of Greenwich. Time to ask again via this petition.

attributes.action: Review the lack of increases in Carers Allowance for full time carers.
attributes.background:
According to a recent survey, carried out by the Carers Trust, caring for sick and/or disabled family members is taking its toll on the health of the nations unpaid carers.

This is going to lead to a care crisis in this country as well as be a massive drain on the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
A carer needs to look after someone for a minimum 35 hours a week, in order, to receive Carers Allowance of £62.10, that`s just £1.78 an hour or less which is far below the National Living Wage and has not been increased the way pensions have.

With the effect of Austerity policies meaning that financial support for carers in the form of Council Tax and Housing benefit having been slashed we are now struggling to survive and we're forced back into part-time work to survive.

We need action now.

attributes.action: Include sexual orientation and gender identity in sexual education.
attributes.background: Sexual education often only talks about heterosexual sex and relationships, which often leaves LGBT people feel left out as they cannot relate to the things they're being taught. By including information about sexual/gender identity, this would help people to understand them and not bully them.
attributes.additional_details: According to Keelly Abbott, “Lesbian, gay and bisexual students could be left vulnerable here with a lack of any sex education that is relevant to them.”, which is often the case. Without the attention to homosexual relationships and gender identity, homophobia and transphobia is prevalent in schools. 50% of trans people, in a study provided by Huffington post, said that they'd experienced transphobic bullying, and 69.1% of LGBT members experiencing homophobia and biphobia.

attributes.action: Call on UK government to stop dealing immediately with Sudan Government
attributes.background: Based on testimony from caregivers and survivors, Amnesty International estimates that more than 200 people may have died as a result of exposure to the chemical weapons agents, with many being children.The majority of survivors of the chemical weapons attacks have had no access to medical care.
attributes.additional_details:
An Amnesty International investigation has gathered horrific evidence of the repeated use of what are believed to be chemical weapons against civilians, including very young children, by Sudanese government forces in one of the most remote regions of Darfur over the past eight months.
Please take an action to end this aggression and dangerous crimes of Sudan Government.

https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2016/09/sudan-credible-evidence-chemical-weapons-darfur-revealed/

attributes.action: Investigate the way Council Tax arrears is processed through the Court
attributes.background: There seems to an exponential increase of late in cases of Council Tax arrears being heard in bulk, by council staff within a 'legal setting' - denying a debtor the right to a fair trial under Protocol 1 Article 6 of the HRA 1998.  This needs to be changed and better measures put into place.
attributes.additional_details: One only need to scour the newspapaers and various media sites,  Facebook being one of those to see people in despair because they have been made to pay without being given the opportunity to fairly represent their case.  Some have been jailed, not because they would not pay but because they could not - It is time to investigate the practices employed by councils in recovery of  Council Tax debts. How can a process be fair when the Councils have declared themselves Judge, Jury and executioner

attributes.action: Prevent the public purse being used to prop up overseas abortion fund
attributes.background: At a time when the NHS is in crisis and other domestic budgets are being cut, we urge the Department for International Development to resist pressure from the Dutch Government to pour millions of pounds into the global abortion fund set up in response to the US withdrawal of global abortion funding.
attributes.additional_details: Belgium, Denmark, Norway & Netherlands have pledged $10m each (£7.9 million) towards covering the £480 million shortfall caused by the US Mexico City Policy. The UK is now being pressured into helping to pick up the rest of the bill which could be in the tens of millions. This would be on top of the £334.9 million of British taxpayer's money that the UK Department for International Development has already committed to overseas programmes for population policies and abortion in 2016-17.

attributes.action: Make PIP Questionnaires fit for purpose regarding Mental Health.
attributes.background:
I believe that the PIP Medical Questionnaire isn't fit for purpose. 
Most questions on the form are aimed at people with physical problems. There are no questions to help you explain about Mental Health & how it effects you daily, which it does.
attributes.additional_details:
So I am starting this petition to see if we can all come together & get the form changed to suit all medical problems like Mental Health. So we can get the right support, which we deserve...

Please sign & share - thank you - Karen Billingsley.

attributes.action: Make wrongful online doxing a criminal offence
attributes.background: Many people, often children, have their private details leaked online. This may include their phone number, address, or even personal photos. This is a form of cyber bullying if the person did not give permission for their details to be leaked. It is essential for this online attack to be illegal.
attributes.additional_details:
www.studyweb.com/doxing/
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doxing
www.gohacking.com/what-is-doxing-and-how-it-is-done/

attributes.action: Make learning and understanding about disabilities part of the curriculum.
attributes.background: As a mother of a young child who has Autism it's a topic close to my heart. We will encounter people from all backgrounds around the world in life that will have a disability. Teaching our youth of today about disabilities and how we are all equal instead of growing up with no knowledge/awareness.
attributes.additional_details: In current curriculum there's areas that need a helping hand. I'm sure that many will agree that there's alot of unhelpful information you received that didn't really help you in 'real' life. By signing this petition your giving people who haven't got a voice a chance to push for a cause that I feel should have always been in place. Why aren't we made aware of disabilities and how we can help others. "Bless those that see the world through a different window and those who understand their view"

attributes.action: Compulsory Mindfulness in all Primary Schools
attributes.background: The current education system is destroying our children;it is a system driven by standardised assessments.This is not the education our children need; they need a system that is concerned about their mental wellbeing, not just test scores. The statistics for children's mental health are overwhelming
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 10 children aged between 5-16years has a mental health problem.It is predicted that mental health illness is to be one of the major health burdens of the coming decade.We have a social responsibility for the wellbeing of the next generation.The system is not going to change, but compulsory MINDFULNESS for all primary children could provide them with vital tools to protect their mental wellbeing. Mindfulness has been shown to reduce stress,anxiety and bad behaviour and improve self-esteem.

attributes.action: Government to demonstrate U.K. will be better off prior to triggering Article 50
attributes.background: The EU referendum resulted in mass country divide with origins from substandard facts. To reassure the UK, the government must publicise robust data & timeframes to prove the UK will be better off (short & long term) including, GDP, inflation, employment, human rights & national security

attributes.action: Stop ticket sites selling direct to partner sites before the public get a chance
attributes.background: Ticket sites are selling to partner 3rd party sites before the public get a chance to buy, the tickets are then sold at inflated prices meaning it's difficult for people to get to see events they want to go to, it's time the government stepped in and put a stop to it
attributes.additional_details: U2 tickets this morning being sold as soon as they were realeased on sale, on seat wave for £300 each, this isn't the first time but this has made me start this petition as it's time the government put a stop to it, modern day touting electronically is worse then the man on the street touting

attributes.action: Allow all healthcare professionals to work as agency staff in other NHS trusts
attributes.background: The legislation IR35 is created to strengthen the balance on tax restraints, to which is appropriate, however, all healthcare professionals should have the right to work in all NHS/HCA trusts, in our spare time as agency workers, despite their permanent role in a specific trust.
attributes.additional_details:
NMC have set revalidation , how do healthcare professionals keep up with the need of hours for  other registrations, without the option to do agency work. There will be an increased demand on contracted hours and staff bank, As there is not enough shifts to go round. 
There will be a complete shift in roles leaving gaps of employment, thus affecting the safety to the public.
There is already a 1% pay cap and now no other options to earn extra funds, to which will cause healthcare professionals becoming financially distressed.

attributes.action: No new dwellings without provision for health care and educational needs.
attributes.background: More and more houses and flats are being built however there is hardly ever any consideration of how this will effect local GPs, Hospitals and schools, many of which are already struggling without the extra load. I believe this needs to be addressed.
attributes.additional_details: Make it necessary for the health and educational needs be addressed before permission to build is issued.

attributes.action: Make anti homeless spikes and other measures of equal effect illegal
attributes.background: "Anti homeless spikes" have been used in public places, especially outside businesses, to prevent those without a home from sleeping there. It is an inhumane means of dealing with the issue and to subject them to further inconvenience, deprives those living in extreme poverty of any dignity.
attributes.additional_details: We have to transition from criminalising poverty, to criminalising behaviour that punishes poverty. The government's lack of action in tackling the problem has led to establishments assuming responsibility and taking measures such as these spikes. Parliament however must act in not furthering the suffering of those living through difficult circumstances. In certain instances individuals have frozen to death and these spikes have forced the displaced to sleep in lethal conditions.

attributes.action: stop funding the royal family with taxpayers money
attributes.background: the royal family is one of the wealthiest in the world. Whilst I don't wish to be disrespectful to HRH we should stop or at least suspend payments from the civil list
attributes.additional_details: many people are going hungry, living out of food banks, having to choose between rent, food or heating. homelessness has risen to an all time high. front line services are strapped for cash. the british tax payer can no longer afford to fund the lavish lifestyle of one of the wealthiest families in the world.

attributes.action: Make Byways Safer
attributes.background: Byways are being used increasingly by motor bikers, as off road circuits, which is putting other users such as walkers and horse riders at risk. Riders in particular, are vulnerable, and a serious accident seems inevitable. We need biker restrictions urgently enforced, before someone is killed.

attributes.action: Include the dangers of online grooming in the national curriculum.
attributes.background: I would like children to be taught about the dangers of online grooming alongside their learning about IT and computers. Paedophiles use the internet to groom young people, but currently this isn't taught in schools.
attributes.additional_details: Children should be made aware of the dangers around online grooming, and it should be made a part of the national curriculum.

attributes.action: Devolve immigration and trade powers to devolved assemblies and Gibraltar
attributes.background:
Each devolved legislature (Scottish Parliament, National Assembly for Wales, Northern Ireland Assembly, London Assembly) and the Gibraltar Parliament shall be granted the power to:

- ratify and make trade treaties (including EU/EEA membership)
- control and decide their own immigration policies
attributes.additional_details:
Scotland’s Place in Europe: http://www.gov.scot/Resource/0051/00512073.pdf

Securing Wales’ Future: https://beta.gov.wales/sites/default/files/2017-01/30683%20Securing%20Wales%C2%B9%20Future_ENGLISH_WEB.pdf

Devolved Parliaments and Assemblies: http://www.parliament.uk/about/how/role/devolved/

Devolution in the United Kingdom: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Devolution_in_the_United_Kingdom

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for building companies to have indemnity insurance
attributes.background: This is to protect consumers against rogue traders, not finishing work, doing incorrect and unsafe work then closing that business down and the consumer unable to claim  any monies back from the builder. This way consumers could then claim against their insurance.

attributes.action: Public Debate and Referendum on Fracking (Shale Gas) in the UK
attributes.background:
Fracking is a controversial process to extract natural gas by fracturing surrounding rock and directly a high pressure mix to release the gas.

I ask for a referendum on whether fracking should be allowed in the UK at all.  Public opinion seems strongly against yet applications are being approved.
attributes.additional_details:
Fracking is once again in the media with the Government ruling that horizontal fracking can go ahead in Lancashire. It follows the approval of fracking at Kirby Misperton in May (although this is delayed to to legal challenges).

There is little consensus on the long term impacts on the area and the surrounding areas after fracking. Examples in the US have resulted in water contamination and air pollution causing headaches and nausea not to mention confirmation of causing earthquakes.

attributes.action: Reduce government approved hazardous waste being sent to our UK landfill sites
attributes.background: Ministers have made the decision NOT to remove the hazardous Air Pollution Control Residues from our landfills.  They agreed to keep the levels of landfill waste at 3X more hazardous than ever before. That is equal to 100+ Olympic sized swimming pools being filled each year with hazardous waste.
attributes.additional_details: DEFRA were reviewing the use of 3x WAC derogation in light of the implementation of the waste hierarchy and government's hazardous waste strategy in 2010.  Principle 6 states that 'The practice of relying on higher Landfill Directive waste acceptance criteria (derogation for 3x WAC) to enable hazardous waste to continue to be land filled must end'. After 6 years of advising, meetings and false promises, the government have agreed to keep filling our landfills. They have ignored their own advice.

attributes.action: Make sign language compulsory from infants at school.
attributes.background: Anyone can become deaf in their lifetime. Surely if more people can sign language people that are deaf or people with special needs adhd or autism that use forms of signs such as makaton to communicate won't feel so isolated.
attributes.additional_details: Children are like a sponge when soaking up knowledge. So if makaton which is an easier form.of sign language is introduced to children at a young age, it would mean that we would eventually all be able to.communicate at some point in life with someone who uses sign language every day. It means future generations can go ask that child thats sat on their own in the playground to come and play with them. They will be able to.communicate, instead of not knowing how to and the child not left isolated no more.

attributes.action: Ban homework in the UK
attributes.background: The children do plenty of work in school
attributes.additional_details: How are they supposed to eat, hang out with friends, do school clubs, bathe and get 8 hours of sleep when they have so much homework?

attributes.action: Stop the Bank of England using Palm Oil in the new £20 notes
attributes.background: The Bank of England are considering using Palm Oil in their new £20 note... very plain and simple, this would add an additional boost to Palm Oil usage & production, which is extremely damaging to the environment. Please sign!
attributes.additional_details:
A couple of links to review - for learning purposes. 

1: https://www.rainforest-rescue.org/topics/palm-oil
2: https://www.theguardian.com/environment/palm-oil
3: http://wwf.panda.org/what_we_do/footprint/agriculture/palm_oil/

attributes.action: Restart Flights to Sharm El Shiekh
attributes.background: Back in October 2015, a Russian flight crashed in Sinai with a suspicion of bombing.After that, many countries had suspended their flights to Sharm El Sheikh.This action has led to many consequences to Egypt's Tourism industry. The Egyptian government had already adopted new security measures.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.cairoscene.com/BusinessAndPolitics/Egypt-to-Install-Biometric-Equipment-to-Bolster-Airport-Security

http://egyptianstreets.com/2017/01/12/egypt-introduces-new-security-measures-for-everyone-travelling-to-south-sinai/

http://egyptianstreets.com/2016/09/28/egypts-tourist-numbers-drop-51-2-in-first-half-of-2016-capmas/

attributes.action: A Parliamentary review of the 2005 Change to the Double Jeopardy Law.
attributes.background: We believe the operation of the change in the the DJ law is not working as Parliament intended. We cite the example of Matthew Hamlen, a 37 year old electrician, and a married man with a son, currently in the custody of HMPS in the UK having been sentenced to 30 years imprisonment in February 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
Matthew has strenuously and consistently denied any involvement both before and during his original trial in 2011/2012 , at which he was unanimously acquitted by the jury, and his later ‘double jeopardy’ trial in January and Feb  2016.

https://matthewhamlenisinnocent.wordpress.com

attributes.action: Make cyclists speeding illegal and insurance mandatory for cyclists
attributes.background: Following serious injuries sustained on my mum by a cyclist doing twice the legal car speed limit in Greenwich park I would like cycle speed limits reviewed, cycle paths reviewed and tracking imposed and the cyclist public liability insurance made mandatory
attributes.additional_details: When treating my mums multiple injuries and assisting her recovery the emergency services advised that a cycle path was removed downhill in Greenwich park which could have prevented this and when trying to slow cyclists down the police get significant abuse from cyclists I therefore think there is a need for a full review of laws relating to cyclists, their speed and actions to prevent such accidents occurring to pedestrians

attributes.action: Stop plans to pay for the restoration of properties belonging to the super rich.
attributes.background: In the current economic climate, it is morally wrong to use public funds to pay for the restoration of such buildings as Wentworth Woodhouse and Buckingham Palace. The owners of said properties should be the ones to pay and the money earmarked for this should be passed on to the NHS immediately.

attributes.action: Make the weekend a THREE day period rather than two.
attributes.background:
Do you feel Weekend is too short, there's not enough time to complete tasks and spend time with family.

Sign this petition to take action on making weekend a THREE day period rather than the current two day weekend.

attributes.action: Allow enlisted men to bear arms around the clock for personal protection in UK
attributes.background:
Our serving military should be allowed to carry sidearms at all times for self defense and for national security so they may act without hesitation to any terrorist threat to themselves or our nation
Our military are trained and are under oath to serve and protect our nation!
Please sign and share
attributes.additional_details:
No more attacks on our protectors like the horrific killing of Fusilier Lee Rigby RIP
Stop the attempted abductions of our serving men and women.
Give our heros the chance to protect themselves along with protecting our nation.

attributes.action: Jeremy Hunt to work a shift on A&E explaining to patients why he's failed us all
attributes.background: We think that Jeremy Hunt should work a shift in any overcrowded A&E Department this winter and go round to every patient, nurse, doctor, ambulance crew and explain how he prepared for this winter and how he's failed us all.

attributes.action: Fully adopt the metric system
attributes.background: The UK has had a mix of measurements for about 50 years when the government committed to converting to the metric system in the late 60s, but the conversion slowed and is still continuing to this day. We should fully adopt the metric system, as it is an international system used by 192/195 countries
attributes.additional_details:
Food/drink is sold in grams/litres except milk and beer which is sold in pints. Fuel is sold in litres but efficiency is in mpg. Vehicles measurements are in metres but warning signs show feet/inches. Road signs are in miles/yards but motorway marker posts are in kilometres. A consistent system prevents confusion but also creates an international system understood by people from all cultures. The government should finish conversion to metric by converting road signs to kilometres (as planned in the 70s). Ireland proved this was done smoothly and at low cost in 2005. The metric system has been used in schools for over 40 years so full adoption wouldn't cause confusion as most people have learned it.
http://www.metric.org.uk/

attributes.action: PIP should be automatically awarded to people diagnosed with Parkinson's
attributes.background: The intention of PIP is to increase people's independence however the assessment criteria is rigged against those with Parkinson's and the assessors don't understand the day to day suffering that we undergo. A diagnosis of Parkinson's is a life sentence and not one that you can be cured of.

attributes.action: Scrap 'killer' diesel cars and compensate owners misled by Government advice.
attributes.background:
From 2001-2015 the UK public were encouraged by Government to buy diesel cars as they were better for the environment.
Now, those cars might be banned because of an estimated 23,500 premature deaths a year.
A scrappage scheme would protect health & compensate well-meaning owners who were misled.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the Chancellor reduced VED in 2001 for cars with low CO2 emissions, and the scrappage scheme of 2009, the UK public were encouraged to buy ‘cleaner diesels’.

In 2015 Lord Drayson said that Government "made a mistake" in encouraging diesel ownership.

We need these vehicles off our roads, but well-intentioned current owners were badly misled by the Government, and will suffer financially, being unable to sell their vehicles, or use them freely due to proposals to limit their use.

attributes.action: The UK government should not enter into any trade negotiations with the USA.
attributes.background: The US administration has put forward the climate change denying America First Energy Policy.  Until such time as this policy is reversed and they take clear and measurable steps to reduce C02 emissions the UK must not enter into any trade negotiations with the USA.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.whitehouse.gov/america-first-energy

attributes.action: Protection to leaseholders/residents to avoid exploitation from Property Mgt Co.
attributes.background: Many Property management companies exploit their position by charging excessive fees whilst providing a very poor service. They hide behind a 91 year old law to justify their actions when in reality they are just taking advantage of the situation to make more profit for the company.
attributes.additional_details: Service charges go up every year without any improvements to the estate. Deficit charges are regularly added onto accounts because of poor budgeting. Expensive Insurance policy's and contracts are taken out and charged back to the leaseholders when they are available a lot cheaper elsewhere. Many leaseholders would like 'the right to manage' themselves but this can be a long winded process which can put many off.

attributes.action: Stop the planned reduction of the tax free dividend from £5k to £2k in April '18
attributes.background: The recent budget the chancellor outlined a reduction in the tax free dividend allowance from £5000 down to £2000. This will hit thousands of small business very hard. As a small business you do not get paid holidays or paid sick leave and small companies already pay corporation tax hitting the SMEs
attributes.additional_details: Chancellors budget 2017. There should be a fairer way to tax the larger companies who pay less corporation tax and take larger dividends. The government want to make this country great again, but you are hitting the backbone of this country the small businesses

attributes.action: Pay sick pay to employees who have been in service for more than 2 years
attributes.background: I am a reliable employee who only takes time off when I am genuinely too ill to get to work but will still go in when I'm too unwell to because I do not get sick pay. Yes I'm entitled to SSP but I would have to be off work for more than for days and it doesn't cover my wages.
attributes.additional_details:
I have been at this work post for 4 years and am a reliable, honest and hard working person. I feel it unfair that I and others in my situation do not have our salary protected for a certain number of weeks a year and are forced to either go in to work sick, have our salary compromised or take more time that is required off just to claim SSP, which I have only ever done once. 
I would like to see employers be made to offer sick pay/salary protection to employees in service for over 2 years

attributes.action: Postpone the revised GCSE in Maths and English set to be taken this summer.
attributes.background: Current Year 11 pupils who are due to sit the revised GCSE exams this summer in Maths and English have attained well below their expected previous grades in recent mock examinations.  This is due to the escalated rate in which the revised curriculum has been introduced.
attributes.additional_details: I am a primary school teacher and the director of private day nurseries but more importantly a parent of a Year 11 pupil.

attributes.action: Make menstrual cups available on the NHS
attributes.background: According to a Huffington Post article women spend £6000 on sanitary products in a lifetime.Providing menstrual cups on the NHS would save women thousands. As they are reuseable it not only provides a good solution for the costly issues but also the environmental issues that sanitary products create
attributes.additional_details: Women on average use around 11,000 disposable sanitary products in a lifetime, which end up in a landfill or the sea. The time it takes for a tampon or pad to degrade in landfills is centuries, particularly when wrapped in a plastic bag. Ocean Conservancy volunteers collected 27,938 used tampons and applicators on our world’s beaches on a single day (International Coastal Cleanup, 2013). Since a menstrual cup can last for up to 10 years, using one would prevent a decade's worth of waste.

attributes.action: Reduce the UK Foreign aid budget to 0.3 per cent of our national wealth
attributes.background:
The £3.5bn extra in England by 2020, not enough.  Similar amount  cut from SC budgets since 2010.  Extra would not solve the longer term problems of caring for a population which is continuing to age.

NHS England funding crisis deepens, with trusts forecasting a £2.3bn deficit by end of the FY.
attributes.additional_details:
More than half trust finance directors (53%) believe care provided is deteriorating.  Most trusts fear they will not be able to meet nationally imposed caps on spending. 9/10 hospitals and 2/3 health trusts  forecasting deficits.  2/3 trusts now reliant on reserves extra help from DOH
1/11 patients waited 4 hours+ worst since 2003.  BMS head “Its clear government is managing the NHS into greater deficit by cutting resources & expecting service improvements at a time of rising demand.”

attributes.action: Postpone notice under art.50 until the question on revocation has been answered.
attributes.background:
The question as to whether notice under art.50 can be revoked once issued remains open, however a definitive answer to this question would be useful to allow MPs to make constructive decisions on the exit process.

A case currently before the High Court in Ireland is addressing this very question.
attributes.additional_details:
This would not be going against the result of the referendum, but would simply allow for Parliament to have the information it needs to properly consider its position and its options and whether a future vote on a proposed deal will be truly meaningful.

Those advocating leaving the EU have waited years for this moment. Waiting a little longer for Parliament to have the information required to consider its options is in the interests of our democracy.

attributes.action: For the UK to remain a full member of the single market
attributes.background: The petition calls on Parliament not to permit the Prime Minster to invoke Article 50 unless the government promises to negotiate for full membership of the single market

attributes.action: demolish Devolution powers in the UK
attributes.background: I am petitioning to get rid of Devolution powers in the UK as it has failed. All powers should be returned to Westminster for the good of the UK union

attributes.action: Mandate ethnic diversity in jury selection where minorities are defendants.
attributes.background: The view that currently underpins jury policy in England & Wales is that a randomly selected jury is most likely to be representative and therefore most likely to be impartial. However several studies have shown that it is in the nature of random selection that some juries will be unrepresentative.
attributes.additional_details:
This particularly applies to cases involving defendants from ethnic minorities. Random selection from a populous where 87.2% of people are white, naturally results in a high likelihood of white-only juries. This raises conflicts in cultural norms and community values. Parliament needs to ensure that this imbalance is removed and one is judged by 'a jury of their peers' to preserve equality, fairness and overall confidence in our legal system.

https://goo.gl/vZxgqS
https://goo.gl/EbKEld
